Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK293) were transfected with LRRK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: The Y1699C mutation resulted in reduced GTPase activity and altered dimerization patterns.

Biological replicates.Description: Number of biological replicates not specified in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Number of technical replicates not specified in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Counts: Number of validation controls not specified in the literature.

Validation controls B/LB.Counts: Number of validation controls not specified in the literature.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: GTPase activity levels consistent with wild-type LRRK2 function.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced GTPase activity below 50% of wild-type levels.

Approved assay.Description: Enzymatic assays and co-immunoprecipitation are commonly used for studying LRRK2 function in the context of Parkinson's disease.
